intro: Acoelorraphe wrightii var. novogeronensis, commonly known as the Florida morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, showy flowers that typically bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks. This variety is distinguished by its smaller, more compact growth compared to the typical A. wrightii.
